inference: The height of the original pyramid is  \[\sqrt{10^2 - (8\sqrt{2}/2)^2} = \sqrt{100-32} = \sqrt{68} = 2\sqrt{17}.\] Since the plane cuts the pyramid 3 units above the base, the height of the smaller pyramid is $2\sqrt{17} - 3$.  The ratio of the heights of the two pyramids is $(2\sqrt{17} - 3) / 2\sqrt{17}$, and since the pyramids are similar, the ratio of their corresponding side lengths is also $(2\sqrt{17} - 3) / 2\sqrt{17}$.  The ratio of the volumes of the two pyramids is the cube of this ratio: \[\left(\frac{2\sqrt{17} - 3}{2\sqrt{17}}\right)^3.\] The volume of the original pyramid is \[\frac{1}{3} (8\sqrt{2})^2 \cdot 2\sqrt{17} = \frac{256\sqrt{17}}{3}.\] Therefore, the volume of the smaller pyramid is \[\left(\frac{2\sqrt{17} - 3}{2\sqrt{17}}\right)^3 \cdot \frac{256\sqrt{17}}{3} = \boxed{\frac{256(2\sqrt{17} - 3)^3}{24\sqrt{17}}}.\]
